intro: Elatostema acutitepalum, commonly known as the acute-lobed elatostema, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the family Urticaceae. It is characterized by its small, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on short pedicels. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Elatostema acutitepalum is known for its ability to thrive in low-light conditions and its preference for well-drained soil.
